Name: Fragment of a stela
Description: Stela of Wadj-Hor, son of Pa-iu-en-Hor. Part of a rectangular stela. The stela resembled a shrine. The decorated part is framed on both sides (and originally also at the top) by a wide band of hieroglyphs. These hieroglyphic bands are themselves framed on the outside by a staff wound around with bands.In the middle of the decorated section are the remains of an offering scene. On the left is probably Osiris with Isis behind him, facing them are a man and a woman. The figures are preserved up to the hips. In between the figures is an offering table.Osiris has been depicted mummiform. Isis is wearing an ankle-length, narrow dress and armbands and anklets. The offering man is wearing a long kilt with diagonal folds. The garments are slightly transparent. The woman behind him is wearing an ankle-length fringed dress.Underneath the offering scene are two horizontal carved lines of text, which read from right to left.
